resources.string: Password Composer is a simpler algorithm that generates weaker passwords. SuperGenPass is recommended.
Lets you pick a password generating algorithm other than SuperGenPass.
When the Go button is pressed, copy the generated password.
This should be value between 4 and 24. A value of 10 for SGP and 8 for PWC is highly recommended for compatibility with the other implementations.

SuperGenPass is a different kind of password manager: instead of randomly generating and storing passwords, it combines a Web site's domain and your master password to generate a unique password for each Web site you visit using a strong cryptographic hash.
In addition to launching it directly, in the Browser activity, go to: Menu → More → Share Page.
To use on your computer, please see the parent project: SuperGenPass.com. This has both a handy bookmarklet as well as a stand-alone Javascript page.
This project is Free Software/Open Source and is licensed under the GNU GPL Version 3. You can get the source for this application from http://staticfree.info/projects/sgp/
Final word of caution: while SGP generates strong passwords, if a malicious Web site knows that you're using SGP and has access to the plain-text of your password for their site, they could potentially brute-force your master password. Therefore it is recommended to make sure your master password is also strong. One great technique for such a password is to use the first letters of a favorite phrase. For example, \"When on Earth, do as the humans do?\" becomes \"W0EdatHd\".
